Detailed Description

This class represents a two-dimensional curve. The shape of the curve has to be set by re-defining the member function calcY in a derived class. This class sets the curve to a sine wave, for testing purposes. This class has no functionality, it just provides parameters to the Plot2D class.

void Curve2D::setLineStyle ( unsigned int lineStyle )
 

Sets the line style of the curve The bits in lineStyle define the pixels in the pattern 0 means a solid line Default: 0xFFFFFFFF

unsigned int Curve2D::getLineStyle ( )
 

Gets the current line style of the curve

Sets the line color of the curve Default: Red (1, 0, 0)

These functions are mainly used by the Plot2D class to draw the curve

Gets the start of the x range in which the curve is defined Default: -1

Gets the start of the x range in which the curve is defined Default: +1

void Curve2D::calcYMinMax ( double & yMin,
double & yMax ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the minimum and maximum value of the curve over the whole definition range Used for autoscaling

void Curve2D::calcYMinMax ( double & yMin,
double & yMax,
double xStart,
double xEnd ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the minimum and maximum value of the curve in the given range Used for autoscaling

double Curve2D::calcY ( double x ) [virtual]
 

Returns the y value corresponding to a given x value This is the function that defines the shape of the curve Default: sin(x) - sine wave for testing purposes

void Curve2D::curveIsUpdated ( ) [virtual]
 

Called by the Plot2D class to reset the d_updateNeeded flag after the curve has been drawn

int Curve2D::isUpdateNeeded ( ) [virtual]
 

Called by the Plot2D class to find out if curve parameters has been changed or the curve itself since the last call of curveIsUpdated
